item.title: Matthew 1

Matthew Chapter 1

1 The Book of the Beginning of Jesus Messiah,

2 Abraham was father of David was father of Shealtiel, father of

3 Judah was father of Rehoboam, father of Azer, 14father of

12 After the exile to

17 So all the generations from Abraham to David (are) fourteen generation, and from David to the carrying-off of-Babylon (are) fourteen generations, and from the carrying-off of-Babylon to [the] Messiah (are) fourteen generations.

item.title: Matthew 2
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 2

1 And [the] Jesus having-been-born in Bethlehem of-[the] Judaea in (the) days of-Herod the king, behold, mage from (the) East arrived in Jerusalem, 2saying, “Where is the-one having-been-born king of-the Jews? For we-saw the star of-him in the East and we-came to-worship him.” 3And having-heard, Herod the king was-troubled and all Jerusalem with him; 4and having-assembled all the chief-priests and scribes of-the people, he-inquired from them where the Messiah would-be-born. 5And the/they said to-him, “In Bethlehem of-[the] Judaea, for thus it-is-written through the prophet,

item.title: Matthew 3
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 3

1 And in [the] those days, John the Baptist comes preaching in the desert of-[the] Judaea 2[and]ms, saying, “Repent, for the kingdom of-[the] heaven came-near.” 3For this is the-one having-been-spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying,

4 And [the] John himself was-having the garment of-him from hairs of-(a)-camel and (a) leather belt around the wait of-him, and the food of-him was locusts and field/wild honey. 5Then Jerusalem was-coming-out to-him and all [the] Judaea and all the territory of-the Jordan, 6and they-were-being-baptized by him in the Jordan River, confessing the sins of-them.

item.title: Matthew 4
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 4

1 Then [the] Jesus was-led by the Spirit into the desert to-be-tempted by the devil. 2And having-fasted for-forty days and forty nights, he-was-hungry afterwards.

3 And the tempter, having-come, said to-him, “If you-are (the) Son of-[the] God, say [in-order]-that [the] these stones become loaves."

4 And the/he, having-answered, said, “It-is-written,

5 Then the devil takes┘him└along into the holy city and stood him on the pinnacle of-the temple, 6and says to-him, “If you-are (the) Son of-[the] God, throw yourself down, for it-is-written [that],

item.title: Matthew 5
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 5

1 And having-seen the crowds, he-went-up one the/a mountain; and he having-sat-down, the disciples of-him came-to him. 2And having-opened the mouth of-him, he-began-to-teach them saying, 11"Blessed are-you when they-insult you and persecute (you) and say all evil against youpl [falsely]ms for-the-sake-of me. 12Rejoice and be-glad, because the reward of-you is much in [the] heaven[s]. For thus they-persecuted the prophets [the] before you. 13"You are the salt of-the earth; but if [the] salt loses the/its saltiness, by-what will-it-be-made salty? It-is-strong for nothing yet except2 having-been-thrown outside to-be-trampled by [the] men. 14You are the light of-the world. A city set on (a) hill is┘not└able to-be-hid. 15Neither do-they-light (a) lamp and put it under the/a bucket but on the/a lampstand, and it gives-light to-all the-ones in the house. 16Let┘the light of-you└shine in-such-a-way before [the] men [in-order]-that they-may-see the good works of-you, and they-may-glorify the Father of-you [the] in [the] heaven[s]. 17"Do┘not└think that I-came to-destroy the Law or the prophets. I-did┘not└come to-destroy (them), but to-fulfill (them). 18For truly I-tell you, until2 the sky and the earth pass-away, one-iota or one serif will┘not└pass-away from the Law until2 all things come-to-be. 19So whoever destroys one of-[the] these [the] least commandments and teaches [the] men so, will-be-called least in the kingdom of-[the] heaven[s]. But whoever2 does and teaches (them)—this-one will-be-called great in the kingdom of-[the] heaven[s]. 20For I-say to-you that unless2 the righteousness of-you exceeds more than the scribes and Pharisees, you-will┘not└enter the kingdom of-the heaven[s]. 21"You-heard that it-was-said to-the ancients, ‘You-shall┘not└commit-murder,’ and whoever commits-murder will-be-liable to-[the] condemnation. 22But I say to-youpl that everyone [the] getting-angry towards-the brother of-him will-be-liable to-[the] condemnation; andwhoever2 says to the brother of-him, ‘Raca,’ will-be liable to-the Sanhedrin, and whoever2 says, ‘Fool,’ will-be liable to the Gehenna of-[the] fire. 23So if you-bring the gift of-yousg to the altar and-there remember that the brother of-you has something against you, 24leave there the gift of-you before the altar and go first reconcile to-the brother of-you, and then, having-come, offer the gift of-you. 25Be coming-to-terms-with the opponent of-you quickly while2 you-are with him on the road, lest-at-any-time the/your opponent deliver you to-the judge and the judge (deliver you) to-the officer and he-put (you) in prison. 26Truly I-say to-you, you-will┘not└come-out from-there until2 you-pay the last quadrans. 27"You-heard that it-was said, ‘You-shall┘not└commit adultery.’ 28But I say to-youpl that everyone [the] looking-at (a) woman unto [the] lusting-after her already committed adultery-with her in-the heart of-him. 29"And if the right [the] eye of-you offends you, pluck┘it└out and throw (it) away-from you, for it-is-better for-you in-order-that one of-the members of-you be-destroyed and not the whole body of-you be-thrown into Gehenna. 30And if the right hand of-you offends you, cut┘it└off and throw (it) away-from you, for it-is-better for-you in-order-that one of-the members of you be-destroyed and not the whole body of-you go-away into Gehenna. 31"And it-was-said, ‘Whoever2 divorces the wife of-him, let-him-give her (a) certificate-of-divorce.’ 32But I say to-you that everybody [the] divorcing the wife of-him—except of-(the)-matter of-sexual-immorality—treats her to-be-(an) adulteress, and whoever2 marries (a)-divorced-one commits-adultery. 33"Again you-heard that it-was-said to-the ancients, ‘Yousg-shall┘not└swear-falsely,’ but, ‘you-shall-perform to-the Lord the oaths of-you.’ 34But I say to-you not to-swear at-all, neither by [the] sky because it-is (the) throne of-[the] God, 35nor by the earth because it-is (the) footstool of-the feet of-him, nor by Jerusalem because it-is (the) city of-the Great King, 36neither shall-you-swearsg by the head of-you, because you-are┘not└able to-make one hair white or black. 37But let┘the word of-youpl└be yes, yes; no, no; but the thing more than-these is of [the] evil/the evil-one. 38"You-heaerd that it-was-said, ‘(An) eye for (an) eye’ and ‘(a) tooth for (a) tooth.’ 39But I say to-you not to-lash-back-at [the] evil, but whoever strikes you on the right cheek [of-you]ms, turn the other to-him also. 40And to-the-one wanting to-sue you and to-take the tunic/shirt of-you, let┘him also└have the/your cloak. 41And whoever forces you (to go) one mile, go with him two. 42Give to-the-one asking you, and do┘not└turn-away-from the-one wanting to-borrow from you. 43"You-heard that it-was-said, ‘Love the neighbor of-you,’ and hate the enemy of-you. 44But I say to-you, love the enemies of-you, and pray for the-ones persecuting you, 45in-order-that you-may-become sons of-the father of-you [the] in heaven[s], because he-raises-up the sun of-him on evil-ones and good-ones and rains on just-ones and unjust-ones. 46For if you-love the-ones loving you, what reward do-you-have? Do┘not even [the] tax-collectors└do the same-thing? 47And if you greet the brothers of-you only, what are-you-doing more? Do┘not even [the] Gentiles└do the same-thing? 48So be perfect/mature like the heavenly [the] Father of-you is perfect.

item.title: Matthew 6
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 6

1 [And]ms be-careful not to-do the righteousness of-you in-front-of [the] men/people unto [the] being-seen by them. And if not, you-do┘not└have (a) reward from the Father of-you in [the] heaven[s]. 2"So when you-do alms, do┘not└blow (a) trumpet in-front-of you, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets in-order-that they-may-be-glorified by [the] men. Truly I-say to-you, they-have the reward of-them. 3But you doing alms, let┘the left (hand) of-you not└know what the right (hand) of-you is-doing, 4in-order-that the alms of-you may-be in [the] secret, and the Father of-you the-One seeing in [the] secret will-reward you. 5"And when you-praypl, do┘not└be like the hypocrites, because they-love to-pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of-the streets, in-order-that they-may-appear to-[the] men. Truly I-say to-you, they-have the reward of-them. 6And when yousg pray, go into the private-room of-you and having-shut the door of-you, pray to-the Father of-you in [the] secret; and the Father of-you the-One seeing in [the] secret will-reward you. 7And prayingpl, do┘not└babble like the Gentiles; they-suppose that they-will-be-listened-to in [the] much-speaking of-them. 8So do┘not└be-like them, for the Father of-you knows of-what-things you-have need before [the] knows of-what-things you-have need before [the] your asking him. 9Thus therefore you pray:

item.title: Matthew 7
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 7

1 Do┘not└criticize in-order-that you-may┘not└be-criticized. 2For with what criticism you-criticize you-will-be-criticized, and with what measure you-measure it-will-be-measured to-you. 3And why do┘you└look-at the piece-of-sawdust in the eye of-the brother of-you, and you-do┘not└recognize the log in [the] your eye? 4Or how will-you-say to-the brother of-you, ‘Let me-take-out the piece-of-sawdust from the eye of-you,’ and behold the/a log (is) in the eye of-you? 5Hypocrite! First take-out the log in the eye of-you, and then you-will-see-clearly to-take-out the piece-of-sawdust from the eye of-the brother of-you. 6"Do┘not└give the holy-thing to-[the] dogs or cast the pearls of-you before [the] pigs, lest-at-any-time they-will-trample them with the feet of-them and, having-turned, they-attach you. 7"Ask and you-will-receive, seek and you-will-find, knock and it-will-be-opened to-you. 8For every one asking receive and the-one seeking finds and to-the-one knocking it-will-be-opened. 9Or, what man of you, whom the son of-him will-ask-for (a) loaf, he-will┘not┘┘└give him (a) stone, └└will-he? 10Or also, (if) he-will-ask-for (a) fish, he-will┘not┘┘└give him (a) snake, └└will-he? 11If then you, being evil, know to-give good gifts to-the children of-you, more by-much the Father of-you [the] in [the] heaven[s] will-give good-things to-the ones asking him. 12So all-things as-many-as-ever2 you-want [in-order]-that [the] men may-do to/for-you, thus you do also to-for them, for this is the Law and the prophets. 13Go-in through the narrow gate, because the gate (is) wide and the way (is) wide leading to [the] destruction, and many are the-ones going-in through it, 14because the gate (is) narrow and the road [the] leading to [the] life (is) restricted, and few are the-ones finding it. 15"Beware of [the] false-prophets, who come to-you in clothing of-sheep, but inwardly they-are savage wolves. 16By the fruits of-them you-will-know them. They-do┘not┘┘└gather grapes from thorns or figs from thistles, └└do-they? 17Thus every good tree bears good fruit[s], and (a) worthless tree bears bad fruit[s]. 18(A) good tree is┘not└able to-bear bad fruit[s], neither (does) (a) worthless tree (bear) good fruit. 19Every tree not bearing good fruit is-cut-down and is-thrown in the fire. 20So by/from the fruits of-them you-will-know them. 21"Not every one saying to-me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will-enter into the kingdom of-[the] heaven[s], but the-one doing the will of the Father of-me [the] in [the] heaven[s]. 22Many will-say to-me in that [the] day, ‘Lord, Lord, did-we┘not└prophesy in-[the] your name, and in-[the] your name cast-out demons, and in-[the] your name do many miracles?’ 23And then I-will-confess to-them [that], ‘I┘never└knew you. Go-away from me, [the]-ones working [the] lawlessness.’ 24"So everyone who hears [the] these words of-me and does them will-be-likened to-(a)-wise man who built the house of-him on [the] bedrock. 25And [the] rain fell and the/a flood[s] came and the wind[s] blew and best-against [the] that house, and it-did┘not└fall, for it-was-built on [the] bedrock. 26And every one hearing [the] these words of-me and not doing them will-be-likened to-(a)-foolish man who built the house of-him on [the] sand. 27And [the] rain fell and the/a flood[s] came and the wind[s] blew and beat-against [the] that house, and it-fell, and the fall of-it (was) great."

item.title: Matthew 8
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 8

1 And he having-come-down from the mountain, many crowds followed him. 2And behold (a) leper, coming-to (him), knelt to-him, saying, “Lord, if you-are-willing, you-are-able to-cleanse me."

3 And having-stretched-out the/his hand, he-touched him, saying, “I-am-willing; be-cleansed.” And immediately the leprosy of-him was-cleansed.

4 And [the] Jesus says to-him, “See (that) you-say nothing to nobody/anybody, but go show yourself to-the/a priest and offer the gift that Moses commanded for (a) testimony to-them."

item.title: Matthew 9
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 9

1 And having-gotten into the boat, he-crossed-over and came into [the] his-own city. 2And behold, they-were-bringing to-him (a) paralytic laid on (a) stretcher. And [the] Jesus, having-seen the faith of-them, said to-the paralytic, “Be-encouraged, son; the sins of-you are-forgiven."

3 And behold some of-the scribes said to each other, “This-one is-blaspheming."

4 And [the] Jesus, having-seen the thoughts of-them, said, “Why are-you thinking bad-things in the hearts of-you? 5For what is easier, to-say, ‘The sins of-you are-forgiven,’ or to-say, ‘Get-up and walk’? 6But in-order-that you-may-know that the Son of-[the] Man has authority on [the] earth to-forgive sins”—then he-says to-the paralytic, “Get-up, pick-up the stretcher of-you and go into the house of-you.” 7And having-arisen he-went-away into the house of-him. 8And the crowd[s], having-seen, were-afraid and glorified [the] God the-one having-given such authority to-[the] men.

item.title: Matthew 10
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 10

1 And having-summoned the twelve disciples of-him, he-gave them authority of-unclean spirits so-as to-cast┘them└out and to-heal every disease and every sickness. 2And these are the names of-the twelve apostles: first Simon, the-one called Peter; and Andrew, the brother of-him; and James, the (son) of-[the] Zebedee, and John, the brother of-him; 3Philip and Bartholomew, Thomas and Matthew, the tax-collector; James the (son) of-[the] Alpheus, and Thaddeus, 4Simon the Cananaean, and Judas [the] Iscariot, the-one also having-betrayed him. “Do┘not└go into (the) way of-(the)-Gentiles, and do┘not└enter into (a) town of-Samaritans. 6But go rather to the lost [the] sheep of-(the)-house of-Israel. 7And going, preach, saying [that], ‘The kingdom of-[the] heaven[s] came-near.’ 8Heal sick-ones, raise dead-ones, cleanse lepers, cast-out demons. You-received freely; give freely. 9Do┘not└get gold or silver or copper for the money-belts of-you, 10no knap-stack for (the) road, neither two cloaks, neither shoes, neither (a) rod; for the worker (is) worthy of-the food of-him. 11And into whatever2 town or village you-enter, find-out who in it is worthy, and┘stay└there until2 you-leave; 12and entering into the house, greet it. 13And if the house (is) worthy, let┘the peace of-you└go onto it; and if it-is not worthy, let┘the peace of-you└return to you. 14And whoever2 does┘not└receive you nor listen-to the words of-you, going outside the house or[the] that town, wipe-off the dust of-the feet of-you. 15Truly I-say to-you, it-will-be more-bearable for Sodom and Gomorrah in (the) day of-judgment than for-[the] that town. 15"Behold, I-am-sending you like sheep in (the) midst of-wolves. So be wise as [the] snakes and harmless as [the] doves. 17And beware of [the] men. For they-will-deliver you to (the) courts, and they-will-scourge you in the synagogues of-them. 18And also you-will-be-led to governors and kings for-the-sake-of me for (a) witness to-them and to the Gentiles. 19And when they-deliver you, do┘not└worry how or what you-will-say, for it-will-be-given to-you in that [the] hour what you-shall-say. 20For you are not the-ones speaking, but the Spirit of-the Father of-you [the] speaking in you. 21And brother will-deliver-up brother to death and father (will deliver up) son, and children will-rise-up against parents and they-will-have┘them└put-to-death. 22And you-will-be hated by all on-account-of the name of-me. 23And when they-persecute you in [the] this city, flee into the other, for truly I-say to-you, you-will┘certainly not└finish the towns of-[the] Israel until2 the Son of-[the] Man comes. 24”(A) disciple is┘not└above the/his teacher, neither (is) (a) servant above the lord of-him. 25(It is) sufficient for-(a)-disciple [in-order]-that he-may-be as the teacher of-him and the servant (to be) as the lord of-him. If-they-called the master-of-the house Beelzebub, more by-much the household-members of-him! 26"So do┘not└be-afraid-of them, for nothing is covered that will be-revealed, and hidden that will-be-made known. 27What I-say to-you in the cark speak in the daylight, and what you-hear in the ear preach on the housetops. 28And do┘not└be-afraid of the-ones killing the body, not being-able to-kill the soul. But fear instead the-One able to-destroy both soul and body in Gehenna. 29Are┘not└two sparrows sold for-(an)-assarion? And one of them does┘not└fall on the ground without the Father of-you. 30And even the hairs of-the head are all numbered. 31So do┘not└fear. You are-worth many sparrows. 32"So everybody who confesses [in] me before [the] men, I┘also└will-confess [in him] before the Father of-me [the] in [the]ms heaven[s]. 33And whoever2 denies me before [the] men, I-will┘also└deny [him] before the Father of-me [the] in [the] heaven[s]. 34"Do┘not└think that I-came to-put peace on the earth. I-did┘not└come to-put peace, but (a) sword. 35For I-came to-divide

item.title: Matthew 11
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 11

1 And it-happened when [the] Jesus finished giving-directions to-the twelve disciples of-him, (that) he-left from-there [the] to-teach and preach in the towns of-them.

2 And [the] John, having-heard in [the] prison the works of-[the] Messiah, having-sent through the disciples of-him, 3he-said to-him, “Are you the-One coming, or are-we-waiting-for another?"

4 And [the] Jesus, having-answered, said to-them, “Having-gone, report to-John what-things you-hear and see. 5(The) blind see and (the) lame walk, lepers are-cleansed and (the) deaf hear, and (the) dead are-raised and (the) poor are-evangelized. 6And blessed is whoever2 is┘not└offended/disappointed in me."

item.title: Matthew 12
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 12

1 In that [the] time [the] Jesus went through the grain-fields on-the Sabbath[s]. and the disciples of-him were-hungry and they-began to-pluck grain-heads and to-eat (the). 2And the Pharisees, having seen, said to-him, “Behold, the disciples of-you are-doing what is┘not└lawful to-do on (the) Sabbath."

3 And the/he said to-them, “Did-you┘not└read what David did when he-was-hungry and the-ones with him? 4How he-entered into the house of-[the] God and ate the loaves of-[the] presentation, which was not lawful for-him to-eat nor for-the-ones with him except for-the priests only? 5Or, did-you┘not└read in the Law that on-[the[] Sabbath[s] the priests in the temple defile the Sabbath and are innocent? 6And I-say to-you that something-greater than-the temple is here. 7And if you had-known what it-is, ‘I-desire mercy and not sacrifice,’ you-wouldhave-condemned2 the innocent 8for the Son of-[the] Man is Lord of-the Sabbath."

item.title: Matthew 13
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 13

1 In [the] that day having-come-out of-the house, [the] Jesus sat-down beside the sea. 2And many crowd[s] were-gathered-together to him, so-that he, having-gotten in (a) boat, sat-down, and all the crowd was-standing on the shore. 3And he-said to-them many-things in parables, saying, “Behold, the/a sowing-one went-out [the] to-sow. 4And in [the] his sowing some fell beside the road, and the birds, having-come, devoured them. 5And others fell on [the] rocky-ground where it-did┘not└have much soil, and immediately it-sprang on-account-of [the] not having depth of-soil. 6And (the) sun having-risen-high, it-was-scorched and on-account-of [the] not having root it-dried-up. 7And others fell to [the] thorns, and the thorns grew-up and choked┘it└out. 8But others fell on [the] good [the] ground and were-bearing fruit, some (a) hundred, some sixty, and some thirty. 9The-one having ears, let┘him└hear."

item.title: Matthew 14
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 14

1 At that [the] time Herod the tetrarch heard the news of-Jesus, 2and he-said to-the servants of-him, “This is John the Baptist. He arose from the dead and on-account-of this, [the] powers are-at-work in him.” 3For [the] Herod, having-arrested [the] John, bound [him]ms, and put (him) in prison on-account-of Herodias, the wife of-Philip, the brother of-him. 4For [the] John kept-telling him, “It-is┘not└lawful for-you to-have her.” 5And desiring to-put┘him└to-death, he-feared the crowd, because they-were-having/hold him as (a) prophet.

item.title: Matthew 15
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 15

1 The Pharisees and scribes from Jerusalem came-to [the] Jesus, saying, 2"On-account-of what do┘the disciples of-you└transgress the tradition of-the elders? For they-do┘not└wash the hands [of-them]ms when they-eat bread?"

3 And the/he, having-answered, said to-them, “On-account-of what do┘you└transgress the commandment of-[the] God on-account-of the traditions of-you? 4For [the] God said, ‘Honor the/your father and the/your mother,’ and ‘The-one cursing father or mother—let-him-die death/surely die.’ 5But you say, ‘Whoever2 says to-the/his father or the/his mother, “(It-is) (a) gift, whatever2 you-would-have benefited from me,’” 6he-will┘certainly not└be-honoring the father of-him. And you-set-aside the word of-[the] God on-account-of the tradition of-you. 7Hypocrites! Well did┘Isaiah└prophesy about you, saying,

item.title: Matthew 16
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 16

1 And the Pharisees and Sadducees, having-come-to (him), testing (him), asked him to-show them (a) sign from [the] heaven/the sky. 2And the/he, having-answered, said to-them, [“Evening having-come, you-say, ‘Good-weather, for the sky is-bright-red.’ 3And in-the- morning, ‘Today, bad-weather; for the sky is-red and is-dark.’ You-know to-interpret/read the face of-the sky, but are-you┘not└able (to-interpret/read) the times?] 4An evil and adulterous generation keeps-looking-for (a) sign, and (a) sign will be-given to-it except2 the sign of-Jonah.” And having-left them, he-went-away.

item.title: Matthew 17
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 17

1 And after six days [the] Jesus talks┘[the] Peter and James and John the brother of-him└aside, and takes┘them└up into (a) high mountain privately2. 2And he-was-transfigured in-front-of them; and the face of-him shined like the sun, and the clothes of-him became white like [the] light. 3And behold Moses and Elijah appeared to-them talking-with them.

4 And [the] Peter, having-answered, said to-[the] Jesus, “Lord, it-is-good for-us to-be here. If you-want, I-will-set-up three tents here, for-you one, and for-Moses one, and for-Elijah one."

item.title: Matthew 18
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 18

1 In that [the] hour the disciples came-to [the] Jesus, saying, “Who is greater/greatest in the kingdom of-[the] heaven[s]?"

2 And having-called (a) little-child, stood him in (the) midst of-them, 3and said, “Truly I-say to-you, if you-do┘not└turn and become like [the] little-children, you-will┘certainly not└enter into the kingdom of-[the] heaven[s]. 4So whoever humbles himself like [the] this little-child—this is the greater/greatest in the kingdom of-[the] heaven, 5and whoever receives one such little-child in (the) name of-me, receives me. 6"But whoever causes┘one of-[the] these little-ones [the-ones] believing in me└to-stumble, it-would-be-better for-him in-order-that (a) millstone of-(a)-donkey is-hung around the neck of-him, and he-be-drowned in the depths of-the sea. 7Woe to-the world from [the] offenses, for it-is-necessary, except woe to-the man through whom the offense comes. 8And if the hand of-you or the foot of-you offends you, cut┘it└off and throw (it) from you. It-is good/better for-you to-enter into [the] life deformed or lame than having two hands or two feet to-be-thrown in to [the] eternal [the] fire. 9And if the eye of-you offends you, pull┘it└out and throw (it) away-from you. It-is good/better for-you to-enter into [the] life one-eyed than having two eyes to-be-thrown into the Gehenna of-[the] fire. 10"See (that) you-do┘not└look-down-on/disregard the angels of-them in heaven[s] continually2 see the face of-the Father of-me [the] in heaven[s]. [11]ms 12What does-it-see, to-you? If (a) hundred sheep are to-any man and one of them strays, will-he┘not└leave the ninety nine on the hills and, having-gone, looks-for the straying-one? 13And if to-find it happens, truly I-say to-you that he-rejoices over it more than over the ninety nine [the] not straying-ones. 14So also it-is not (the) will before the Father of-you [the] in heaven[s] [in-order]-that one of-[the] these little-ones be-lost. 15"And if the brother of-you sin [against you]ms, go, confront him between you and him alone. If he-listens-to you, you-gained the brother of-you. 16But if he-does┘not└listen, take-along with you yet one or two, in-order-that ‘at (the) mouth of-two witnesses or three every matter may-be-established.’ 17But if he refuses-to-listen-to them, speak to-the church. And if he-refuses┘even└to-listen-to the church, let-him-be to-you like the/a Gentile and the/a tax-collector. 18"Truly I-say to-you, as-many-things-as2 youpl-bind on [the] earth will-certainly-be-bound2 in heaven, and as-many-things-as2 youpl-loose on [the] earth will-certainly-be-loosed2 in heaven. 19Again [truly]ms I-say to-you that if two of you agree on [the] earth about every matter whatever2 you-may-ask, it-will-be to-them from the Father of-me in heaven[s]. 20For where two or three are gathered in [the] my name, I-am there in (the) midst of-them."

item.title: Matthew 19
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 19

1 And it-happened when [the] Jesus finished [the] these words, he-departed from [the] Galilee and he-came into the mountains of-[the] Judaea beyond the Jordan. 2And many crowd[s] followed him and he-healed them there.

3 And Pharisees came-to him, trying him and saying [whether], “Is-it lawful for-(a)-man to-divorce the wife of-him for every reason?"

4 And the/he, having-answered, said, “Did-you┘not└read that the-One having-created (them), from (the) beginning ‘made them male and female’? 5and said, ‘For-the-sake-of this (a) man will-leave the/his father and the/his mother and unite-with the wife of-him, and the two will-become [for] one flesh; 6so-that they-are no-longer two but one flesh. What then [the] God joined-together let┘not man└separate."

item.title: Matthew 20
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 20

1 For the kingdom of-[the] heaven[s] is like (a) landowner man who went-out early to-hire workers for the vineyard of-him. 2And having-agreed with the workers of (a) denarius for-the day, he-sent them into the vineyard of-him. 3And having-gone-out about (the) third hour, he-saw others standing idle in the market-place, 4and said to-them, ‘You also go into the/my vineyard, and whatever is right I-will-give you.’ 5And the/they went-away. [And]ms again having-gone-out (the) sixth and ninth hours, he-did likewise. 6And about the eleventh hour, having-gone-out, he-found others standing and said to-them, ‘Why are-you-standing here the whole day idle?’ 7They-say to-him, ‘Because nobody hired us.’ He-says to-them, ‘You also go into the/my vineyard.’ 8And evening having-come, the lord of-the vineyard says to-the foreman of-him, ‘Call the workers and give them the/their pay having-begun from the last to the first.’ 9And having-come, the-ones about the eleventh hour received (a) denarius apiece. 10And having-come, the first thought that they would receive more, and they received [the/a]ms denarius also. 11And having-received (it), they-began-to-grumble against the landowner, 12saying ‘These [the] last do for-one hour, and you-made them equal to-us the-ones having-borne the burden of-the day and the heat.’ 13But the/he, having-answered to-one of-them, said, ‘Friend, I-did┘not└mistreat you. Did-you┘not└agree-with me of-(a)-denarius? 14Take (the) your-thing and go. But I-want to-pay this [the] last-one as also (I-paid) you. 15[Or]ms, is-it┘not└lawful for-me to-do what I-want with [the] my-things?’ 16Thus the last will-be first, and the first (will be) last."

item.title: Matthew 21
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 21

1 And when they-got-near to Jerusalem and they-came to Bethany to the Mount of-[the] Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples, 2saying to-them, “Go into the village across-from you, and immediately you-will-find (a) donkey tied and (a) colt with her. Having-untied (them), bring (them) to-me. 3And if anybody says anything to-you, you-shall-say [that], ‘The Lord has need of-them.’ And immediately he-will-send them.” 4And this-thing has-happened in-order-that the-thing spoken through the prophet might-be-fulfilled, saying,

item.title: Matthew 22
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 22

1 And having-responded, [the] Jesus spoke again in parables to-them, saying, 2"[The kingdom of-[the] heaven[s] was/is like (a) king man who made(a) marriage-feast for-the son of-him. 3And he-sent the servants of-him to-call the-ones invited to the wedding-feast[s], and they-did┘not└want to-come. 4Again he-sent other servants, saying, ‘Say to-the ones invited, “Behold, the meal of-me I-have prepared, the oxen of-me and the grain-fed-calves 9are) butchered. All-things (are) ready. Come to the feast[s].”’ 5But the/they, not-paying-any-attention, went-away, one to [the] his field, and one to the business of-him. 6And the rest, having-grabbed the servants of-him, treated-(them)-disgracefully and killed (them). 7And the king was-furious and, having-sent the soldiers of-him, destroyed [the] those murderers and burned the city of-them. 8Then he-tells the servants of-him, ‘The wedding-feast is ready, but the-ones invited were not worthy. 9So go into the main-roads of-the roads and as-many-as you-find invite to the marriage-feast[s].’ 10And having-gone-out into the roads, [the] those servants assembled all whom they-found, both evil and good, and the wedding-feast was-filled of-reclining-ones-at-table. 11And the king, having-come-in to-inspect the-ones reclining-at-table, saw there (a) man not dressed in-dress of-(a)-wedding-feast, 12and he-says to-him, ‘Friend, how did-you-come-in here not having dress of-(a)-wedding-feast?’ And the/he was-speechless. 13Then the king said to-the servers, ‘Having-bound him feet and hands, throw┘him└out into the outer [the] darkness. [The] crying and [the] gnashing of-[the] teeth will-be there. 14For many are called, but few (are) chosen.’"

item.title: Matthew 23
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 23

1 Then [the] Jesus said to-the crowd[s] and to-the disciples of-him, 2saying, “The scribes and the Pharisees sit on the seat of-[the] Moses. 3So do and keep all-things as-many-as2 they-say to-you, but do┘not└do according-to the works of-them, for they-say and do┘not└do. 4And they strap heavy loads and difficult-to-carry and put (them) on the shoulders of-[the] men, but they do┘not└want to-move them with the/a finger of-them. 5And all the works of-them they-do unto [the] being-seen by-[the] men. For they-broaden the phylacteries of-them and lengthen the/their tassels. 6And they-love the main-seat at [the] dinners and prominent seats in [the] synagogues 7and [the] greetings in [the] market-places, and (love) to-be-called by [the] men ‘Rabbi.’ 8But do┘not└you be-called ‘Rabbi.’ For One is the teacher of-you, and you are all brothers. 9And do┘not└call ‘father’ of-you on [the] earth, for One is the heavenly [the] Father of-you. 10Neither be-called leaders because one is leader of-you—the Messiah. 11But the greater/greatest of-you will-be (a) minister of-you. 12But whoever will-exalt himself will-be-humbled and who humbles himself will-be-exalted. 13"And woe to-you, scribers and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because you-shut the kingdom of-[the] heaven in-front-of [the] men, for you do┘not└go-in, neither do-you-let the-ones trying-to-enter to-go-in. [14]ms 15"Woe to-you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because you-go-around [the] sea and [the] land to-make one proselyte, and when he-becomes (one), you-make him twice-more (the) son of-Gehenna than yourselves.” 16"Woe to-you, blind guides the-ones saying, ‘Whoever2 swears by the sanctuary it-is nothing, but whoever2 swears by the gold of-the sanctuary, he-is-under-obligation.’ 17Fools and blind! For which is greater, the gold or the temple [the] having-sanctified the gold? 18And ‘whoever2 swears by the altar, it-is nothing, but whoever2 swears by the gift [the] on it, he-is-under-obligation.’ 19Blind! For which is greater, the gift or the altar [the] sanctifying the gift? 20Therefore the-one having sworn by the altar swears by it and by all-things [the] on it. 21And the-one having-sworn by the sanctuary swears by it and by the-One dwelling-in it, 22and the-one having-sworn by [the] heaven swears by the throne of-[the] God and by the-one sitting on it. 23"Woe to-you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because you-tithe [the] mint and [the] dill and [the] cumin, and neglect the heavier-things of-the Law—[the] justice and [the] mercy and [the] faith. And it-was-necessary to-do these-things and┘not to-neglect└those. 24Blind guides! The-ones straining-out the gnat and swallowing the camel! 25"Woe to-you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because you-clean the outside of-the cup and the plate, but inside they-are-full of greed and self-indulgence. 26Foolish Pharisees! Cleanse first the inside of-the cup in-order-that the outside may┘also└become clean. 27"Woe to-you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because you-are-like whitewashed tombs, which outside appear attractive, but inside they-are-full of (the) bones of-dead-(men) and all uncleanness. 28Thus also you outside appear to-[the] men righteous, but inside you-are full of-hypocrisy and lawlessness. 29"Woe to-you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because you-build the tombs of-the prophets and decorate the graves of-the righteous; 30and you-say, ‘If we-were in the days of-the fathers of-us, we-would┘not└have-been fellows in the blood of-the prophets.’ 31So-that you-testify to-yourselves that you-are sons of-the-ones having-murdered the prophets. 32And you fill-up the measure of-the fathers of-you. 33Snakes! Nests of-vipers! How will you-escape from the condemnation of-[the] Gehenna? 34On-account-of this, behold, I send to you prophets and wise-ones and scribes. Some-of them you-will-kill and you-will-crucify, and some-of them you-will-scourge in the synagogues of-you and persecute from city to city, 35in-order-that may-come on you all righteous blood shed on the earth from the blood of-Abel the righteous to the blood of-Zechariah, son of-Berechiah, whom you-murdered between the sanctuary and the altar. 36Truly I-say to-you, all these-things will-come on [the] this generation. 37"Jerusalem! Jerusalem! The-one murdering the prophets and stoning the-ones sent to it. How-many-times did-I-want to-gather the children of-you which way/like (a) hen gathers the chicks of-her under the/her wings, and you-did┘not└want-(to). 38Behold, the house of-you is-left to-you desolate. 39For I-say to-you, you-will┘certainly not└see me from now till you-say, ‘Blessed (is) the-One coming in (the) name of–(the)-Lord.’"

item.title: Matthew 24
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 24

1 And having-gone-out, [the] Jesus was-going from the temple, and the disciples of-him came to-show him the buildings of-the temple-complex. 2And the/he, having-answered, said to-them, “Do-you┘not└see all these-things? Truly I-tell you, stone on stone will be-left that will┘certainly not└be-utterly-destroyed."

3 And he sitting on the Mount of-[the] Olives, the disciples came-to him privately2, saying, “Tell us, when will┘these-things└be and what (will be) the sign of-[the] your coming and (the) end of-the age/world?"

item.title: Matthew 25
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 25

1 Then the kingdom of-[the] heaven[s] will-be-like then virgins, who, having-taken the lamps of-them, they-went-out to meeting the groom. 2Now five of them were foolish and five (were) wise. 3For the foolish, having-taken the lamps of-them, did┘not└take oil with them. 4But the wise took oil in [the] flasks with the lamps of-them. 5And the groom delaying, they-got-drowsy and fell-asleep. 6And during (the) middle of-(the)-night, (a) shout came,, ‘Behold, the groom! Come-out for meeting [him]ms.’ 7Then all [the] those virgins got-up and trimmed the lamps of-them. 8Now the foolish said to-the wise, ‘Give us of the oil of-you, because the lamps of-us are-going-out.’ 9But the wise answered, saying, ‘No, there-will┘certainly not└be-enough for-us and for-you. Go instead to the selling-ones and buy for-yourselves.’ 10And they going-away to-buy, the groom came, and the-ones prepared entered with him into the wedding-feast and the door was-shut. 11And later the remaining virgins also come, saying, ‘Lord, lord, open for-us.’ 12And the/he, having-answered, said, “Truly I-say to-you, I-do┘not└know you.’ 13So watch, because you-do┘not└know the day nor the hour. 14"For as (a) man leaving-on-a-trip called [the] his servants and delivered to-them the possessions of-him. 15And to-one he-gave five talents, and to-another (he gave) two, and to-another (he gave) one, to-each according-to [the] his ability, and left. 16Immediately having-gone, the-one having-received five talents traded with them and earned five others. 17Likewise the-one (having-received) the two (talents) earned two others. 18But the-one having-received the one (talent), having-gone-away, dug (the) ground (in) (the) ground and hid the silver-(coin)/money of-the lord of-him. 19And after (a) long time the lord of-[the] those servants comes and settles account with them. 20And having-come, the-one having-received the five talents brought five other talents, saying ‘Lord, you-gave five talents to-me. Behold, I-earned five other talents.’ 21The lord of-him said to-him, ‘Well, good and faithful servant; you-were faithful over (a) few-things; over many-things I-will-put┘you└in-charge. Enter into the joy of-the lord of-you.’ 22[And]ms also having-come the-one (having-received) the two (talents) said, ‘Lord, you-gave me two talents. Behold, I-earned two other talents.’ 23The lord of-him said to-him, ‘Well, good and faithful servant, you-were-faithful over (a) few-things; I-will-put┘you└in-charge over many-things. Enter into the joy of-the lord of-you.’ 24And having-come, the-one having-received the one talent said, ‘Lord, I-knew you that you-are (a) hard man, reaping where you-did┘not└scatter. 25And having-been-afraid, having-gone-away, I-hid the talent of-you in the ground. Behold, you-have [the] your (talent).’ 26And having-answered, the lord of-him said to-him, ‘Wicked and lazy servant, you-knew that I-reap where I-did┘not└sow and gather whence I-did┘not└scatter? 27I-was-necessary for-you then to-put the silver-coins/money of-me with-the bankers, and, having-come, I would-have-received [the] my (talent) with interest. 28So take from him the talent and give (it) to-the one having the ten talents. 29For to-the everybody having it-will-be-given and he-will-abound, but of-the-one not having even what he-has will-be-taken from him. 30And throw-out the worthless servant into the out [the] darkness. [The] bitter-crying and [the] gnashing of-[the] teeth will-be there. 31"And when the Son of-[the] Man comes in the glory of-him and all the angels with him, then he-will-sit on (the) throne of-(the) glory of-him. 32And all the nations will-be-gathered-together before him, and he-will-separate them from one-another as the/a shepherd separates [the] sheep from [the] goats. 33And he-will-stand the sheep on (the) right[s] of-him, but the goats on (the) left[s]. 34Then the king will-say to-the-ones on (the) right[s] of-him, ‘Come [the] blessed-ones of-the Father of-me; inherit the kingdom prepared for-you from (the) foundation of-(the)-world. 35For I-hungered and you-gave me (something) to-eat; I-thirsted and you-watered me/you gave me (something)-to-drink, I-was (a) foreigner and you-took┘me└in, 36naked and you-clothed me; I-was-sick and you-visited me; I-was in prison and you-came to me.’ 37Then the righteous will-answered him, saying, ‘Lord, when did-we-see you hungering and nourish (you), or being-thirsty and water you? 38And when did-we-see you (a) foreigner and take-(you)-in, or naked and clothed (you). 39And when did-we-see you being-sick or in prison and come to-you?’ 40And having-answered, the king will-say to-them, ‘Truly I-tell you, unto as-much-as you-did (it) to-one of-the least of-these [the] least [the] brothers of-me, you-did (it) to-me.’ 41"Then he-will-say also to-the-ones on (the) left[s], ‘Go from me, [the]ms accursed, into the eternal [the] fire [the] prepared for-the devil and the angels of-him. 42For I-hungered and you-did┘not└give me (anything) to-eat; I-thirsted and you-did┘not└water me; 43I-was (a) foreigner and you-did┘not└take┘me└in, naked you-did┘not└visit me? 44Then they will-answer, saying, ‘Lord, when did-we-see you hungering or thirsting or (a) foreigner or naked or sick or in prison and not take-care-of you?’ 45Then he-will-answer them, saying, ‘Truly I-tell you, unto as-much-as you-did┘not└do (it) to-me.’ 46And these will-go-away into eternal punishment, but the righteous into eternal life."

item.title: Matthew 26
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 26

1 And it-happened when [the] Jesus finished all [the] these words (that) he-said to-the disciples of-him. 2"You-know that after two days comes the Passover, and the Son of-[the] Man is delivered unto [the] being-crucified." 3Then the chief-priests and the elders of-the people gathered-together in the court of-the high-priest the-one called Caiaphas, 4and they-plotted in-order-that they-might-arrest [the] Jesus by-stealth and put┘(him)└to-death. 5And they-were-saying, “Not in the feast, in-order-that (a) riot not arise among the people."

item.title: Matthew 27
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 27

1 And morning having-come, all the chief-priests and the elders of-the people took counsel against [the] Jesus so to-put┘him└to death; 2and having-bound him, they-led┘(him)└away and delivered (him) to Pilate the governor.

3 The Judas the traitor, having-seen that he-was-condemned, having-regretted, returned the thirty [the] silver[s]-shekels to-the chief-priests and elders, 4saying, “I-sinned, having-betrayed innocent blood."

5 And having-thrown the silver-shekels into the sanctuary, he-departed; and having-gone-away, he-hanged himself. 6And the chief-priests, having taken the silver-shekels, said, “It-is┘not└lawful to-put them in the Treasury, because it-is (the) price of-blood.” 7And having-taken counsel, they-bought from them the field of-the potter as (a) grave for-[the] foreigners. 8Wherefore [the] that field was-called Field of-Blood unto the today. 9Then the-thing spoken through Jeremiah the prophet was-fulfilled, saying,

item.title: Matthew 28
item.description:
Matthew Chapter 28

1 After the Sabbath[s], at-the dawning toward (day) one of the Sabbath[s]. Mary the Magdalene and the other Mary came to-see the grave. 2And behold (a) great earthquake happened, for (an) angel of (the) Lord, having-descended from heaven and having-come-to (it), rolled┘the stone└away and sat-down on it. 3And the sight of-him was like lightning and the garment of-him (was) white like snow. 4And from the fear of-him, the-ones keeping watch shook and became like dead-(men). 5And the angel, having-answered said to the women, “Do┘not you└be-afraid, for I-know that you-are-seeking Jesus the-One crucified. 6He-is not here, for he-arose even-as he-said. Come, see the place where he-was-lying. 7And quickly having-gone, say to-the disciples of-him [that], ‘He-arose from the dead-(ones), and behold, he-goes-ahead-of you into the Galilee. You-will-see him there.’ Behold, I-told you."
